title: Back In Session, Congress Faces Budget Bill, ISIS Threat
teaser: Congress was back in town on Monday for a two-week sprint before the midterm elections. On the schedule: pass a budget bill so the government doesn't shut down again, decide the fate of the agency that helps businesses finance U.S.-exported goods and figure out what to do about ISIS.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
